    • Method Detail

      • setPeerNodes

        public WalletConfig setPeerNodes(org.bitcoinj.core.PeerAddress... addresses)
        Will only connect to the given addresses. Cannot be called after startup.

      • setAutoSave

        public WalletConfig setAutoSave(boolean value)
        If true, the wallet will save itself to disk automatically whenever it changes.

      • setDownloadListener

        public WalletConfig setDownloadListener(org.bitcoinj.core.listeners.PeerDataEventListener listener)

      • setAutoStop

        public WalletConfig setAutoStop(boolean autoStop)
        If true, will register a shutdown hook to stop the library. Defaults to true.

      • setBlockingStartup

        public WalletConfig setBlockingStartup(boolean blockingStartup)
        If true (the default) then the startup of this service won't be considered complete until the network has been brought up, peer connections established and the block chain synchronised. Therefore startAndWait() can potentially take a very long time. If false, then startup is considered complete once the network activity begins and peer connections/block chain sync will continue in the background.

      • setSeed

        public WalletConfig setSeed(@Nullable
                            org.bitcoinj.wallet.DeterministicSeed seed)
        If a seed is set here then any existing wallet that matches the file name will be renamed to a backup name, the chain file will be deleted, and the wallet object will be instantiated with the given seed instead of a fresh one being created. This is intended for restoring a wallet from the original seed. To implement restore you would shut down the existing appkit, if any, then recreate it with the seed given by the user, then start up the new kit. The next time your app starts it should work as normal (that is, don't keep calling this each time).

      • setDiscovery

        public WalletConfig setDiscovery(@Nullable
                                 org.bitcoinj.net.discovery.PeerDiscovery discovery)
        Sets the peer discovery class to use. If none is provided then DNS is used, which is a reasonable default.

      • isChainFileLocked

        public boolean isChainFileLocked()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Tests to see if the spvchain file has an operating system file lock on it. Useful for checking if your app is already running. If another copy of your app is running and you start the appkit anyway, an exception will be thrown during the startup process. Returns false if the chain file does not exist or is a directory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
